ygData.subject: RE: Value of lambent stones  and quest items (was AC Di lemma)
ygData.msgSnippet: Unfortunately, you run into these types of people sometimes.  One time, before I got my black silk gloves, I was in MM and auctioned that I needed a pair.  At
ygData.messageBody:
Unfortunately, you run into these types of people sometimes. One time,
before I got my black silk gloves, I was in MM and auctioned that I needed a
pair. At the time I only had 5PP in cash on me. I had put the rest in the
bank to avoid the extra weight. My earlier experiences in Lower Guk had led
me to believe that most people would just let you loot the quest components
if they didn't need them. Thats how I got my shin greaves and gauntlets. A
few minutes after I auctioned, someone announced a pair was available in the
graveyard. I was the only bard in MM at the time. I went to the graveyard
and told the guy all I had on me was 5PP. He told me that wasn't enough
money to get the gloves. Enough time had passed where I could have looted
the corpse had I wanted to( but I wouldn't have stooped that low). This guy
had that covered though because the whole time I was talking to him, he was
looting the corpse so no one else could loot it. I told him that I was the
only bard in MM and that all I had was 5PP, he could take it or leave it.
He decided to continue looting the corpse until it disappeared to ensure
that I didn't get the gloves without paying him. The guy wasn't smart
enough to figure out that 5PP was better than nothing at all. To say the
least, I told him not to expect my help if he was ever in a bind. That was
one more person added to my /ignore list.

Galtin of E'ci

> When I was in Cazic Thule the other day I was waiting on my group to get
> there. I went over near the
> Gorilla spawn because that's where I was going to hunt with my group.
>
> There was another group there and I role-played asking them if I could
> loot a mudwater Rune from a
> Fanatic if that got one as I needed it to complete a quest.
>
> They rudely said no only if you pay us 100PP for loot rights. I politely
> left the area and said
> thank you but that was to high.
>
> I know the argument of "there killing it, it's there loot." but if you
> don't need it don't loot it.
> Or charge a reasonable price to loot it.
>
> Was it going to kill them to help someone out?
>
